intro: Cryptocarya ferrarsi var. ferrarsi, commonly known as the New Zealand sandalwood, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to New Zealand, characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional Māori medicine, it is of ecological and cultural significance.
